results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections;Polls and Public Opinion;Abbott, Gregory W (1957- );O'Rourke, Beto;Texas
results.title: After Recent Turmoil, the Race for Texas Governor Is Tightening
results.abstract: A series of tragedies and challenges have soured the mood of Texans and made the governor’s race perhaps the most competitive since the 1990s.

media.caption: Gov. Greg Abbott addressed the 2022 National Rifle Association conference in a prerecorded video in Houston on May 27, three days after the Uvalde school shooting. He and his Democratic challenger, Beto O’Rourke, differ widely on gun control issues.
media.copyright: Mark Abramson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Heat and Heat Waves;Weather;Global Warming;New York City;Northeastern States (US)
results.title: Triple-Digit Temperatures Break Records in the Northeast
results.abstract: Daily record highs were set in cities along the East Coast, including Boston and Newark, which was on its fifth day of triple-digit temperatures.

media.caption: Tony Lopez at East River Park in New York on Sunday. Temperatures were expected to exceed New York’s previous July 24 record of 97 degrees, which was set in 2010, forecasters said.
media.copyright: Gabby Jones for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Names, Personal;Women and Girls;Marriages;Celebrities;Lopez, Jennifer;Affleck, Ben
results.title: Why It Matters That J-Lo Is Now J-Aff
results.abstract: I like the romance of Bennifer 2.0 as much as the next person, but her name change makes me wince.

results.adx_keywords: Pregnancy and Childbirth;Cancer;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Abortion;Doctors;States (US);United States
results.title: After Roe, Pregnant Women With Cancer Diagnoses May Face Wrenching Choices
results.abstract: Urgent questions arise about how care of pregnant women with cancer will change in states where women are unable to terminate pregnancies

media.caption: Half of cancers in pregnant women are breast cancer, but many others occur and complicate an already complex medical situation.

results.adx_keywords: Classical Music;Opera;Deaths (Fatalities);Soltesz, Stefan (1949-2022);Bavarian State Opera;Munich (Germany)
results.title: Conductor Dies After Collapsing During Performance in Munich
results.abstract: Stefan Soltesz was in the middle of Richard Strauss’s “The Silent Woman” when he fell from his podium shortly before the end of the first act.

media.caption: Stefan Soltesz is the fourth conductor to collapse midperformance in Munich since the early 1900s.

results.adx_keywords: Marburg Virus;Disease Rates;Bats;World Health Organization;Ghana
results.title: What to Know About the Marburg Virus Disease
results.abstract: Two people infected with the virus died in Ghana last month, though no other cases were found, experts said. The disease’s fatality rate is high.

media.caption: Researchers gathering bats in 2018 at Queen Elizabeth National Park in Uganda to study the animals’ role in transmission of the Marburg virus.
media.copyright: Photo by Bonnie Jo Mount/The Washington Post via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Building (Construction);Shortages;Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);Interest Rates;United States Economy;United States
results.byline: By Conor Dougherty and Ben Casselman
results.title: We Need to Keep Building Houses, Even if No One Wants to Buy
results.abstract: Right now, builders have too many homes and not enough people to sell them to. In the long term, the United States has the opposite problem: Not enough houses for all the people who want them.

media.caption: “We’re going to look project by project and say which ones are we are going to go ahead on and which we are going to take a pause on,” said Randal Lewis of the Lewis Group of Companies, which is doing work in Chino, Calif.
media.copyright: Philip Cheung for The New York Times

results.title: Baltimore Prosecutor Defeated in Democratic Primary Amid Legal Woes
results.abstract: Marilyn Mosby, who rose to national prominence for her handling of the death of Freddie Gray, was indicted in January on charges of perjury and financial misconduct.

media.caption: Marilyn Mosby spoke to supporters and campaign workers on Tuesday night after the election.

results.byline: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman
results.title: In Jan. 6 Hearings, Gender Divide Has Been Strong Undercurrent
results.abstract: An investigation that has revealed grave threats to democracy, plotted and carried out mostly by men, has a heavily female cast of narrators who have paid a public price for speaking out.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;internal-sub-only-nl;Project Democracy;Presidential Election of 2020;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right
results.byline: By Blake Hounshell and Nick Corasaniti
results.title: A Hidden New Threat to U.S. Elections
results.abstract: Some Republican-led counties are refusing to certify election results — a move that could throw American democracy into chaos if it becomes widespread.

media.caption: Election workers scanning ballots last month in Lancaster, Pa. The county and two others have refused to process certain absentee ballots, which has delayed the state’s certification of its primary results.

results.byline: By Richard Fausset and Rick Rojas
results.title: Mississippi Fires Lawyer Trying to Recoup Misused Welfare Funds
results.abstract: The lawyer had issued a subpoena that could reveal details about the involvement of a former governor and a football star in the scandal.

media.caption: A subpoena issued to the University of Southern Mississippi Athletic Foundation involving the building of a volleyball facility asks for communications that foundation members may have had with individuals including Brett Favre.

results.title: No More Pet Store Puppies? New York May Finally Ban Sales.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Defense and Military Forces;Civilian Casualties;Prisoners of War;Steel and Iron;Factories and Manufacturing;Rescues;Metinvest Holding LLC;Mariupol (Ukraine);Ukraine;Russia
results.title: Last Stand at Azovstal: Inside the Siege That Shaped the Ukraine War
results.abstract: For 80 days, at a sprawling steelworks, a relentless Russian assault met unyielding Ukrainian resistance. This is how it was for those who fought, and for those trapped beneath the battlefield.

media.caption: By May, after months of battle, the Azovstal Iron and Steel Works was a charred skeleton.

results.byline: By Richard Fausset and Danny Hakim
results.title: On the Docket: Atlanta v. Trumpworld
results.abstract: Eighteen months into a criminal investigation of election interference by Donald J. Trump and his allies, a Georgia prosecutor is beginning to show the broad contours of her inquiry.

media.caption: Fani T. Willis, the Atlanta area district attorney, is bringing a case against the former president’s supporters that may involve racketeering charges.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.byline: By Alexander S. Rabin and Gregg L. Furie
results.title: The Cruel Irony of Inhalers That Make Climate Change Worse
results.abstract: Some inhalers use greenhouse gases to help deliver medication into the lungs. The good news is there are alternatives.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Discrimination;Race and Ethnicity;Black People;Hispanic-Americans;Hazardous and Toxic Substances;Justice Department;Houston (Tex)
results.title: Justice Dept. Will Investigate Environmental Racism in Houston
results.abstract: The inquiry, part of an administration-wide racial justice initiative, came amid claims that the city has ignored illegal dumping in Black and Latino areas.

media.caption: The investigation is likely to be one of the most ambitious environmental justice reviews undertaken by the Justice Department in recent years.
media.copyright: Sergio Flores for The New York Times
